Description: Papyrus(six fragments); Demotic text recto and verso.
Curator's comments: Kim Ryholt to publish ('P. BM EA 10655 and 10966 both join papyri in the Papyrus Carlsberg Collection that I am preparing for publication, i.e. P. Carlsberg 567 and P. Carlsberg 467. One is a ptolemaic annuity contract that is important since it mentions a hermotybies from Chemmis (one of the two warrior classes) and provides the first verification of Herodotus on this point. The other is an obscure account of cloth from Roman times.')
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (93271) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/93271)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bloom, insect attack, frayed, displaced fragments Black ink Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
